title: Method 1: Roblox Studio​
content: Get Ragdoll System from the Roblox Library.Drop it right into ReplicatedStorage

title: Method 2: Wally​
content: Make sure you have wally installed.Add Ragdoll System to your wally.toml dependency list. wally.toml [dependencies] RagdollSystem = "leastormer/ragdoll-system@0.2.0"  Run wally installRagdoll System is ready to be used.

title: Extending the System
content: Extending the System So you want to create a different type of ragdoll than R15 or R6? No problem create a Blueprint and add it to the RagdollFactory. MyBlueprint.lua local MyBlueprint = {} MyBlueprint.numConstraints = 38 --Test it, create a ragdoll with your blueprint, print(#ragdoll._constraints) and replace 38 with the number you get. MyBlueprint.socketSettings = {} --The keys are names of BaseParts in your model. MyBlueprint.cframeOverrides = {} --The keys are names of BaseParts in your model. function MyBlueprint.satisfiesRequirements(model: Model): boolean --How can we tell that model satisfies my blueprint? end function MyBlueprint.finalTouches(ragdoll: Ragdoll) --Do something with ragdoll, or don't, ragdoll won't mind. end return MyBlueprint Main local MyBlueprint = require(path.to.MyBlueprint) local RagdollFactory = require(path.to.RagdollSystem).RagdollFactory RagdollFactory.addBlueprint(MyBlueprint)

title: RagdollConstructed​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> RagdollFactory.RagdollConstructed: Signal Fires when a ragdoll is constructed by the factory.

title: new​
content: </> RagdollFactory.new( model: Model , blueprint: Blueprint? ) → Ragdoll? Constructs a ragdoll from a model that satisfies any of its blueprints. Returns nil if no blueprint is satisfied.

title: addBlueprint​
content: </> RagdollFactory.addBlueprint(blueprint: Blueprint) → () Adds a blueprint to the factory. Retroactively updates all existing ragdolls to this type of ragdoll if they satisfy its requirements.

title: SocketSettings​
content: </> interface SocketSettings { MaxFrictionTorque: number UpperAngle: number TwistLowerAngle: number TwistUpperAngle: number }

title: SocketSettingsDictionary​
content: </> type SocketSettingsDictionary = {[string]=SocketSetting} Each string must refer to a Basepart within the character this blueprint describes.

title: CFrameOverrides​
content: </> type CFrameOverrides = {[string]={ C0: CFrame , C1: CFrame }} Each string must refer to a Basepart within the character this blueprint describes.

title: numConstraints​
content: </> Blueprint.numConstraints: number? Number of constraints created following this blueprint tip Putting an accurate number can improve the performance of ragdoll construction slightly, although it isn't necessary.

title: socketSettings​
content: </> Blueprint.socketSettings: SocketSettingsDictionary Used to describe the range of motion of each BasePart within the ragdoll.

title: cframeOverrides​
content: </> Blueprint.cframeOverrides: CFrameOverrides? Used to change how specific parts in the ragdoll are attached on the ragdoll. For example, in the R6 blueprint the arms are overridden to be attached the same way Upper Arms are attached in R15 Characters.

title: satisfiesRequirements​
content: </> Blueprint.satisfiesRequirements(model: Model ) → boolean Returns whether the model can be properly constructed by this blueprint.

title: finalTouches​
content: </> Blueprint.finalTouches(ragdoll: Ragdoll) → () Apply final touches to the ragdoll. For example, in the R15 blueprint some extra NoCollisionConstraints are added to make the ragdoll physics flow smoother.

title: addRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> RagdollSystem:addRagdoll(ragdollModel: Model ) → Ragdoll Creates and caches a ragdoll corresponding to the Model.

title: removeRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> RagdollSystem:removeRagdoll(ragdollModel: Model ) → () Destroys the ragdoll corresponding to the model and removes it from the cache.

title: getRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> RagdollSystem:getRagdoll(ragdollModel: Model ) → Ragdoll? Returns the ragdoll corresponding to the model or nil if there isn't one.

title: getPlayerRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the server. Server </> RagdollSystem:getPlayerRagdoll(player: Player ) → Ragdoll? Returns the ragdoll corresponding to player's character or nil if there isnt one.

title: getLocalRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> RagdollSystem:getLocalRagdoll() → Ragdoll? Returns the ragdoll coresponding to the local player's character.

title: activateLocalRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> RagdollSystem:activateLocalRagdoll() → () Activates ragdoll physics on the local player's ragdoll.

title: deactivateLocalRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> RagdollSystem:deactivateLocalRagdoll() → () Deactivates ragdoll physics on the local player's ragdoll.

title: collapseLocalRagdoll​
content: This item only works when running on the client. Client </> RagdollSystem:collapseLocalRagdoll() → () Activates ragdoll physics on the local player's ragdoll, deactivates ragdoll physics after the ragdoll has remained still for 1.5 seconds.
